text: Elihu Rebukes Job
“But now, please hear my speeches,\f + \fr 33:1 \ft Or “my sentences,” or “what I have to say” \f* Job,
and hear\f + \fr 33:1 \ft Or “give ear to” \f* all my words.
Please look, I open my mouth;
my tongue in my mouth speaks.
My words \add declare\add* my heart’s uprightness,
and my lips sincerely speak ⸤what my lips know⸥.\f + \fr 33:3 \ft Literally “the knowledge of my lips” \f*
The Spirit of God has made me,
and the breath of Shaddai gives life to me.
“If you are able, answer me.
Present \add your argument\add* ⸤before me⸥;\f + \fr 33:5 \ft Literally “to the face of me” \f* take your stand.
Look, before God ⸤I am like you⸥;\f + \fr 33:6 \ft Literally “I \fq am \ft like your mouth” \f*
I myself was also formed from clay.
Look, dread of me should not terrify you,
and my hand will not be heavy upon you.
“Surely you have spoken in my ears,
and I have heard \add the\add* sound of \add your\add* words:\f + \fr 33:8 \ft Or “sentences,” or “what \fq you \ft say” \f*
‘I \add am\add* clean, without transgression;
I \add am\add* pure, and \add there is\add* no guilt in me.
Look, he finds fault against me;
he reckons me as his enemy;
he puts my feet in the block;
he watches all my paths.’
“Look, \add in\add* this you are not right—I will answer you:
Indeed, God is greater than a human being.
Why do you contend against him,
that he will not answer all a person’s words?
Indeed, God speaks in one \add way\add*,
even\f + \fr 33:14 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* in two,\f + \fr 33:14 \ft Or “time and again” (NJPS, HCSB) \f* \add yet\add* \add someone\add* does not perceive it.
“In a dream, a vision of \add the\add* night,
when a deep sleep falls on men slumbering on \add their\add* bed,
then he opens \add the\add* ear of men,
and ⸤he frightens them with a warning⸥\f + \fr 33:16 \ft Literally “with their warning he frightens” \f*
to turn human beings aside \add from their\add* deeds,
and he keeps man from pride.
He spares his life from \add the\add* pit
and his life from passing over the river \add of death\add*.
“And he is reproved with pain on his bed,
even\f + \fr 33:19 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add with\add* the strife of his bones continually,
⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 33:20 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* his life loathes bread,
and his inner self\f + \fr 33:20 \ft Or “soul” \f* \add loathes\add* ⸤appetizing food⸥.\f + \fr 33:20 \ft Literally “food of desire” \f*
His flesh is wasted away from sight,
and his bones, \add which\add* are invisible, are bared.
And ⸤he⸥\f + \fr 33:22 \ft Literally “his inner self/soul” \f* draws near to the pit
and his life to the killers.
“If there is a messenger beside him, a mediator, one of a thousand,\f + \fr 33:23 \ft That is, “unique,” or “one of a kind” \f*
to declare to a human being his uprightness
⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 33:24 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he is gracious \add to\add* him, and he says,
‘Deliver him from descending into \add the\add* pit;
I have found a ransom.’
His flesh is renewed with \add his\add* youth;
he returns to \add the\add* days of his youthful strength.
He prays to God, then he accepts him,
and he sees his face with a shout of joy,
and he repays to the human being his righteousness.
“He will sing to men, and he will say,
‘I have sinned and have perverted \add what is\add* right,
and it was not paid back to me.
He redeemed my life from going down into the pit,
so\f + \fr 33:28 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* ⸤I will enjoy the light⸥.’\f + \fr 33:28 \ft Literally “my life in the light will see” \f*
Look, God does all these \add things\add*
twice, three times\f + \fr 33:29 \ft Or “time and again,” or “oftentimes” (NASB, NASU), or “several times” \f* with a person
to bring his life back from \add the\add* pit
⸤so that he may enjoy the light of life⸥.\f + \fr 33:30 \ft Literally “to be lighted with the light of the life” \f*
“Listen attentively, Job; listen to me;
be silent, and I will speak.
If ⸤you have anything to say⸥,\f + \fr 33:32 \ft Literally “If there are words,” or “If there are sentences” \f* ⸤answer me⸥;\f + \fr 33:32 \ft Literally “return to me” \f*
speak, for I desire ⸤to justify you⸥.\f + \fr 33:32 \ft Literally “your righteousness” \f*
If not, you listen to me;
be silent, and I will teach you wisdom.”
